metadata.synopsis: A zany agent (Groucho Marx) books a Brazilian bombshell (Carmen Miranda) again, as a French singer, in the same club on the same night.

reviews: Four Marx Brothers made history, but one Marx cannot make a film.
The result is not so wildly zany as the best Marx brothers collaborations, nor is it designed to be. But it is an unpretentiously entertaining movie.

However, hardcore Marxists already know that, as Groucho's first solo film appearance, 1947's Copacabana was a once-over-slightly effort that the Master himself dismissed before the cameras even rolled.
